WHO ARE WE? 
   There are over 30M small businesses in the United States, but only a tiny fraction of them have a workplace savings program in place. As the savings gap in the country widens, it's imperative that every worker has access to and participates in their company's savings program, such as a 401(k) or 403(b). We believe that American workers should have easy access to an inexpensive, flexible, and intuitive solution to save for a brighter future.  Unfortunately, prior to Vestwell, small businesses have been neglected and underserved, with expensive, inflexible, poorly designed offerings built on old, mainframe software. Vestwell is changing that, starting with rebuilding the core infrastructure for the modern era.  Vestwell's north star is to be the engine behind a $30T industry, powering all payroll-deducted workplace savings programs for small-to-midsize businesses, such as 401(k), 403(b), IRA, emergency savings accounts (ESA), health savings accounts (HSA), 529 college savings, and alike.  Vestwell's focus is to build the most flexible, powerful workplace savings and investment platform, delivered through the hands and minds of their financial services partners with the help of payroll provider partners. The team at Vestwell makes the hard stuff look easy, by combining the expertise of financial advice with the sophistication of a technology provider.  As a result, workplace providers are able to bestow the advice and solution employers and employees have been asking for, while growing and scaling along the way. Employers get a cost-effective solution designed for their needs without all the headaches, and employees get a user-friendly portal that helps them achieve their long-term saving goals. 
   WHY VESTWELL? 
   With backing from leading FinTech investors, as well as a growing team of dedicated professionals of strong industry pedigree, Vestwell is at the forefront of a much-needed change in a 40-year old industry. Our team believes in the mission we've set out to achieve and we are working hard to get there. We're ambitious, honest, thoughtful, and fun. 
   
 
 
 WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?  The Engineering team is seeking an experienced Software Engineer to join our AI Solutions team. The ideal candidate will be instrumental in developing robust AI-driven applications, contributing to both our product offerings and internal process enhancements. This role demands a blend of technical prowess, innovative thinking, and a commitment to quality. 
  You're a great fit for our team if you can balance detail-oriented tasks with long term strategy and scale initiatives. Most of all, you must be passionate about what you create and about the impact it can have. 
  WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING? 
  
  Design, develop, and maintain AI solutions, focusing on high-quality, scalable, and reliable production-level code. 
  Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to integrate AI features into products and internal tools. 
  Prototype and iterate on solutions rapidly in Python, with a strong grasp of machine learning principles. 
  Utilize machine learning frameworks such as scikit-learn and PyTorch to implement and optimize algorithms. 
  Leverage APIs from leading LLM providers and other tools like LangChain to implement RAG and agentic workflows across the enterprise 
  Develop front-end prototypes and tools using JavaScript to showcase and interact with AI functionalities. 
  Analyze data to extract insights, inform decision-making, and measure the impact of AI solutions. 
  
 Requirements The Necessities 
  
  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field. 
  Minimum of 3 years of experience in ML/AI software development, with a proven track record of delivering production-level code. 
  Experience delivering Python applications to production. 
  Familiarity with basic machine learning concepts and experience in applying them using frameworks like Scikit-learn and PyTorch. 
  Ability to prototype front-end tools using JavaScript/HTML 
  Experience with Docker, AWS, and other cloud services for deploying and scaling applications. 
  Knowledge of testing frameworks and commitment to developing reliable, well-tested code. 
  Experience with RDBMS (Postgres preferred) 
  Strong knowledge of AI algorithms, techniques, and technologies. 
  Strong communication, collaboration, and interpersonal skills. 
  Experience in an Agile environment working with tools such as GitHub, Jira, and Jenkins. 
  
 The Extras 
  
  Fintech experience 
  Startup experience 
  
 OUR CULTURE  We take a modern Agile approach to development, trusting cross-functional squads to make bottom up decisions in terms of roadmap prioritization, technical choices, and day-to-day processes. 
  We want squads to be first class citizens, working as a team to define their roadmap and prioritization, that follows best practices in development, automation testing, deploying, and support.
  
  The expected salary range for this position is $160K - $180K with a bonus variable. Please note that salary bands are based on NY and other similar metro areas and may differ based on where the role is ultimately hired. 
  For your awareness you will only receive correspondence from recruiting@vestwell.com any other domain not ending in Vestwell.com is not our Recruitment team. 
  Vestwell's Privacy Policy. Attention California residents: In the course of conducting our business and complying with federal, state, and local government regulations governing such matters as employment, tax, insurance, etc., we must collect Personal Information from you. Should you accept employment with Vestwell you may view our California Privacy Rights Act here: Vestwell's California Privacy Rights Policy.
 
   OUR BENEFITS 
   We're a growth stage startup with lots of exciting milestones ahead. We value health and wellness at Vestwell and in addition to a dedicated Employee Wellbeing Committee, we offer competitive health coverage and an open vacation policy. We have adopted a remote-hybrid office policy, but all employees are welcome at our bright, comfortable office with many workspace options in midtown Manhattan so everyone has a setting that is the most productive for them. We provide our team with all the equipment they need (plus a few perks!) to work effectively remotely. Oh, and naturally we have a great 401(k) plan!

As a Staff Data Scientist , you will drive the next generation of innovative IDEXX products for our customers and internal solutions for our employees. You’ll work with various research data, healthcare data types for clinical settings, and diverse business domain and functional data. In this role, you will have an opportunity to incorporate AI into veterinary diagnostics, clinical software, lab and medical consulting services, instruments, and internal operations. 

 IDEXX, an innovative diagnostics and technology company, leads the way in providing cutting-edge products and services that support veterinarians, livestock, and water health. 
IDEXX Data and AI Centre Of Excellence (COE) develops and delivers data and AI assets and solutions to enhance IDEXX products, services, internal operations, and business practices. 
In this role 

 Scope and Evaluate AI Models & Systems:
 You will assess existing AI models and systems to support and modernize them with current frameworks and advanced data integration. 
You will leverage your expertise in NLP model architectures and contribute to designing new model architectures, including GenAI. 

 Design and Develop AI-Driven Solutions:
 You will create AI solutions for veterinary diagnostics product portfolios, focusing on efficiency and accuracy in extracting clinical information and optimizing clinical diagnostic workflows. 
You will develop algorithms and models to enhance, classify, and organize text data for data products and AI-based features in software and from instruments. 
You will address complex challenges with sophisticated NLP, data-centric AI, and AI-based workflows, included in AI-enhanced data models, chatbots, or multi-agent systems supporting intricate processes. 

 Collaborate and Streamline Processes:
 You will understand workflow challenges and develop AI tools to streamline processes and enhance efficiency. 
Work closely with product owners and subject matter experts from veterinarian health domains. 

 Research and Technical Implementation:
 You will contribute to guiding technical implementation for AI infrastructure. 
You will tailor solutions to support the development of complex products, improve operational efficiency, and optimize algorithm architecture. 

 AI/ML Lifecycle :
 You will help maintain an existing AI/ML model portfolio while expanding the portfolio by defining requirements, creating solution designs, and implementing code. 
You will support solutions throughout the deployment and on-market lifecycle, focusing specifically on fine-tuning and optimizing LLMs-based solutions (e.g., RAG, routing, performance). 

 Collaborate Across Teams:
 You will work with product and business stakeholders to prioritize needs and ensure successful implementation and adoption. 
You will research and contribute to guiding technical implementation for AI infrastructure tailored to supporting the development of complex products, impacting development efficiency, compute, and solution design. 
What you need to succeed 
You have 10+ years of experience in machine learning, with some experience with healthcare or similar complex data types. 
You have a master’s or a PhD with additional relevant experience. 
You have experience creating and productionalizing NLU, NLP, and LLM solutions by fine-tuning open-source models. 
You have advanced programming skills in Python, PySpark, and database languages like SQL. 
You have experience with libraries and frameworks commonly used in NLP, such as NLTK, spaCy, TensorFlow, or PyTorch. 
You are proficient in the entire ML development lifecycle, including AI and ML frameworks and LLM optimization, and have experience with MLOps lifecycle management. 
You are familiar with Databricks, GPU clusters in cloud environments (including AWS and Azure), and distributed training frameworks for large-scale models. 
You have experience with end-to-end feature development (owning feature definition, roadmap development, and experimentation). 
You have excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills and can convey rigorous mathematical concepts and considerations to non-experts. 
You have a record of authored research publications and industry or community contributions like whitepapers, workshops, etc. 
You can collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including veterinarians, software engineers, and internal stakeholders. 
What you can expect from us 
Base annual salary target: $135000 - $175000 depending on knowledge and experience 
Opportunity for annual equity award 
Opportunity for annual cash bonus 
Health / Dental / Vision Benefits Day-One 
5% matching 401k 
Additional benefits include but are not limited to financial support, pet insurance, mental health resources, volunteer paid days off, employee stock program, foundation donation matching, and much more! 
Why IDEXX 
We’re proud of the work we do because our work matters. An innovation expert in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Core Values to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals healthy and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from disease. We have customers in over 175 countries and over 10,000 talented employees globally. 
So, what does that mean for you? We enrich the livelihoods of our employees with a positive and respectful work culture that encourages learning and discovery. At IDEXX, you will be motivated by generous compensation, incentives, and benefits while enjoying purposeful work that drives improvement. 
Let’s pursue what matters together. 

 IDEXX values diversity and encourages women, people of color, LGBTQ persons, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply.

The growing Match Group Central Platforms team is looking for an analyst to work cross-functionally with the Match Group organization, and our portfolio of brands, to help identify, understand, and improve business, operations, and product challenges. Reporting to the Director of Product, the Senior Data Analyst will deliver high-quality strategic and tactical analysis; collaborating with the product, engineering, data science, business intelligence, member experience and operations teams.
 
 
 
   Know where you belong. Match Group is a leading provider of dating products across the globe. Our portfolio includes Tinder, Match, Hinge, Plenty of Fish, The League, and others, each designed to spark meaningful connections for singles worldwide. Creating a sense of belonging doesn’t stop at our products - it’s the foundation of every team we hire.
 
 
 
   We are flexible and offer full remote or hybrid working models as options to accommodate our team. Match Group is headquartered in Dallas, TX, with offices in LA, Palo Alto, and New York.
 
  
  
  In this role you will: 
 
  Own defining, tracking, and monitoring business KPIs for the Central Platforms Product team.
   Partner with product managers to create hypotheses, define quantitative goals, and design experiments for roadmap projects
   Partner with engineering to improve data collection through data infrastructure design, data pipelining, and warehousing solutions
   Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including business stakeholders, developers, and data engineers, to identify data requirements, gather feedback, design and implement solutions.
   Conduct exploratory data analysis to discover patterns and insights to inform future strategy.
   Gather, compile, and extract meaningful insights from complex datasets, using statistical techniques and machine learning algorithms when applicable.
   Summarize and evangelize your findings across the company; providing Executives, Product Managers, Engineering teams, and other Data Analysts with deep-dive quantitative analyses in an immediately usable format, extracting key insights from extensive, complex data sets
   Proactively find opportunities to take analytics framework into the next level and lead stakeholders to adopt new frameworks and methodologies
   Take ownership of ambiguous and complex analytical assignments
 
  We could be a Match if you have: 
 
  5+ years of progressive experience using quantitative analysis to make business-focused recommendations
   3+ years of analytics experience working directly with product managers or embedded within a product team
   Experience with data warehousing, data pipelining solutions a plus
   Familiarity with machine learning concepts and algorithms
   Proven technical data analytics skills in working with large amounts of data at different levels of aggregation, from raw telemetry to metric stores.
   Working knowledge of trust and safety analytics metrics (fraud signals, bad actor patterns, etc.)
   Strong understanding of incrementally as well as sizing business problems and opportunities
   Understanding of basic statistical concepts such as confidence interval, normal distribution, correlation, linear regression, and multivariate testing
   Strong communication skills at different levels of organizational hierarchy
   Proactive skill set that encompasses problem identification, analysis, solution definition, results, and communication
   Proficiency with SQL, R and Python (or equivalent)
   In depth experience with data visualization and analytical tools (E.g. Tableau, Power BI, Looker)
 
 
   Factors such as scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate's work experience, education/training, job-related skills, internal peer equity, as well as market and business considerations may influence base pay offered. This salary range is reflective of a position based in Los Angeles, CA. This salary will be subject to a geographic adjustment (according to a specific city and state), if an authorization is granted to work outside of the location listed in this posting.

Job Description:
Job Title: Senior Manager/Director, BI, and Forecasting 
Location: Remote
Job Type: Full-time/Permanent
In this role, you will see a direct link between your work and company growth. The role is highly cross-functional and will require coordination with several departments such as Supply Chain Management, Marketing, Operations, Finance, and others. This role conducts a wide range of business analysis, defines and communicates the appropriate metrics that are needed to accurately and objectively measure business performance and execute on the company’s goals. The role’s activities include interpreting financial and operational trends, identifying deviations from the expected performance, and conveying results to various departments within the organization. This strategic director-level role will challenge the candidate to understand and contribute to many facets of the company including business analytics, risk, and revenue forecasting, data management, and executive reporting. You would be managing a team of professionals utilizing advanced SQL skills, statistical analysis, and MS BI stack to achieve these objectives.
Primary Duties and Responsibilities
· Directing and overseeing high level strategic and tactical decisions for business intelligence tools and applications.
· Prioritizing and directing the projects and initiatives of the Business Intelligence and Forecasting team, that includes 8 team members in 3 locations.
· Researching, analyzing and explaining the current and past activity, expected trends, and the potential effect of the changes made. Presenting and supporting findings and recommendations to various management levels within the organization.
· Driving projects related to the design and development of automated decision-making systems for the business. Answering questions and suggesting improvements on the proprietary systems created earlier, such as Product-level Demand Forecasting, Net Margin calculations system, Lead Times calculation system, Automatic Pricing system, etc.
· Coaching a team on the pros and cons of different types of analytics, data modeling, and providing mentorship on extrapolating and examining insights from large data sets.
· Participating as an SME and helping in other company-wide projects. Providing expertise for other departments when it comes to profitability measurement, ROI measurement, understanding impact on cash conversion cycle, etc.
· Coordinating a big number of one-time custom activities concerned with data collection, analysis, reconciliation, trends investigation.
· Organizing the metrics and dashboards setup for various areas of the business using MS BI Stack (PowerBI, SSRS reports and subscriptions) and other custom reporting tools.
· Building long-term high-level forecasts for major financial metrics. Maintaining the model, monitoring trends compared to the model, and digging into issues.
· Providing leadership in the development, implementation, and ongoing management of all key performance indicators (KPIs) and reporting capabilities for a number of operational areas. Using insights to challenge the organization to be more efficient and cost-effective.
· Providing guidance to our Procurement teams during large purchasing campaigns and strategic buys.
· Acting as a liaison between our Finance and the Business, reconciling financial and operational reports and KPIs.
Qualifications, Skills and Requirements
· 5+ years of managerial experience in the BI field
· MA/MS or higher degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Applied Math, Physics, or other technical field
· Understanding of Ecommerce, Retail, Supply Chain Management, Finance and Marketing
· Strong MS SQL/MySQL skills
· Experience or deep understanding of Microsoft BI tools: SSRS, SSAS, SSIS, PowerBI
· Advanced MS Excel skills
· Experience solving analytical problems using other technical field approaches
· Excellent Communication skills
· Proficiency in utilizing Google Analytics. Google BigQuery expertise is a plus
· Experience in E-commerce is a major plus
· Expertise/background in artificial intelligence/machine learning is a plus
· Some programming experience is a plus (PHP, C++, JavaScript, VBA, or others).
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $150,000.00 - $200,000.00 per year

What is Teamshares?
 
 
 
   Teamshares is a mission-driven startup that buys small businesses from retiring owners and transitions them into enduring, employee-owned businesses through our software, education, and community products. There wasn't an easy way for small businesses—which make up 98% of firms in the US economy—to become employee-owned before Teamshares!
 
 
 
   About the role
 
 
   Teamshares is looking for a manager to lead our data science and analytics efforts. This person will have a critical role in how we leverage our data to improve our business and be a leader in the tech org at Teamshares.
  
 What you’ll do
 
   Be an advocate for how data can give Teamshares a competitive advantage by forming a vision for how we can use data science methodologies to improve our business
   Provide guidance and mentorship to junior staff and peers in the Data Science & Analytics function more broadly, fostering an environment of excellence, innovation, and collaboration.
   Build predictive models using statistical and machine learning techniques used for classification and regression. Assess model performance and communicate with stakeholders.
   Foster a data driven culture by proactively elevating metrics reporting and understanding
   Guide development of new and more sophisticated applications of data
   Collaborate with partners in product and finance to translate business needs into suitable technical solutions with the appropriate level of detail.
   Derive insights from data to improve our understanding of our network companies, their journey, and the effectiveness of our tactics to improve financial performance
 
  Who you are
 
   2+ years experience as a people manager
   Strong experience in developing and implementing an analytic vision to solve business-relevant problems, as well as motivating and leading teams to successful implementation.
   Exceptional problem-solving abilities and the capacity to translate complex data into actionable insights.
   Prior experience in delivering impact using statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and machine learning.
   Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with both technical and non-technical partners as well as senior leadership
   Effective storytelling ability with experience leading business conversations with senior leadership.
   Experience at a high-growth company that has undertaken an IPO.
 
 
   Why should you join us?
 
 
 
   Teamshares believes in supporting every team member with a competitive salary and a generous benefits package, including: equity for all employees, exceptional medical/dental/vision benefits plans for employees and their families, and paid parental leave.
 
 
 
   We recognize and facilitate the tangible impacts each employee has on our mission, while still maintaining a healthy work-life balance culture that emphasizes unplugging at the end of the work day. Our team values time off and actually takes vacation. We embody a growth mindset and provide the support you need to grow in your career.

Job Description:
   Looking to make an impact by developing disruptive artificial intelligence technologies? Saab Inc. is seeking an innovative Software Engineer to work with our technical teams through our Co-Op program this summer (May-August timeframe). This Co-Op opportunity is open to in office or remote. 
  You will be defining, implementing, integrating, verifying, delivering, and maintaining autonomy and artificial intelligence-based capabilities for a variety of multi-domain platforms.
   Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
  
   
    
      Highly collaborative research and development, including the design and development of novel systems with Ph.D.-level subject matter experts and academic researchers.
    
   
    
      General data science practices, including the curation of big data and experience with Python machine learning libraries.
    
   
    
      Algorithm design and software development, in collaboration with members of our technical team.
    
   
    
      Working with a team of engineers to design, implement, unit test, document, and maintain software in multiple programming languages on Linux, Windows, and embedded platforms.
    
   
    
      Apply fundamentals and best practices of software engineering to create innovative solutions and solve challenging problems.
    
   
    
      Support software modeling, simulation, integration, and test activities as needed.
    
   
    
      Present and discuss technical concepts, tradeoffs, analyses, designs, and performance estimates.
    
   
    
      Follow through on full product lifecycle: development, prototyping, integration, verification, delivery, and support as required including operations and at-sea prototyping and testing.
    
  
   In addition to a competitive hourly rate, Saab Inc. offers a sign-on bonus to off-set housing expenses for Co-Ops residing outside the typical office commuting distance.
   Compensation Range: $20-$22/hr
   The compensation range provided is a general guideline. When extending an offer, Saab, Inc. considers factors including (but not limited to) the role and associated responsibilities, location, and market and business considerations, as well as the candidate's work experience, key skills, and education/training.
   The compensation range provided is a general guideline. Data Science Manager
  
  
  Greenbox Capital is a dynamic and growing FinTech company that has been providing working capital to small businesses in Canada and the USA for 12 years, providing cutting-edge financial services in the US and Canada with strong revenue streams and a steady growth curve. Speed, accuracy, and automation are causing the company to grow exponentially.
  
  
  We look to derive business value through advanced predictive data modeling and Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. We are applying predictive technology to large volumes of data and against a wide spectrum of business and owner data to make fast and accurate credit decisions, trend forecasting.
  
  A successful candidate will be a person who is innovative, with a product development mindset, and will understand how to further differentiate our financial products on the market to create more stickiness. The candidate enjoys working with many departments and wearing many hats as this person will be responsible for various projects inside the organization working with our Leadership team. With our “Growth Mindset” and Inclusive Team Culture at Greenbox Capital, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of personal and professional growth while producing bottom line results.
  
  Qualifications:
  
  
  
  8+ years of deep industry experience in predictive & algorithmic modeling, data science, and data analysis, specifically with experience in developing FinTech products. 
  Experience in startup, scale and exits and/or entrepreneurial environments. 
  Experience with ML fields, e.g., predictive analytics and financial modeling, statistical learning theory. 
  Experience in data scientist role building and mentoring. 
  Experience with maintaining and monitoring ML models in a production environment. 
  Expertise in modelling & building systems using Python. 
  Experience in diving into data to discover hidden patterns, using data visualization tools, writing SQL, and working with modern tools to develop models. 
  Experience writing and speaking about technical concepts to business, technical, and lay audiences and giving data-driven presentations.
 
  
  
  Responsibilities:
  
  
  
  Fully accountable for the success and failure of the Data Science team technical deliveries. 
  Collaborate with business domain subject matter experts in various departments to understand the problem and the objectives. 
 
 
  Research and build innovative predictive statistical models for all areas of the business. 
  Ability to translate complex data into actionable insights for a non-technical audience. 
  Maintain, tune, improve model behavior with live data for the company’s credit decision model for lending operations to drive profitability. 
  Provide mentorship to junior data scientists in aspects of machine learning, data and software engineering, and assist them with practical guidance, when needed. 
  Strong teaching and mentoring skills for the purpose of building up talent and delegating responsibilities to ensure maximum productivity and grow the team 
  Dynamic working style able to handle many moving pieces at once. 
  Vocal and able to communicate needs and opinions to senior leaders. 
  Team player, open minded, motivated, dedicated and highly value-driven.

FERMÀT enables eCommerce brands to transform clicks into conversions with highly-personalized , 1:1 dynamic shopping experiences. We've raised $30M+ to date and are backed by Bain Capital Ventures, Greylock, and QED.
  Role Overview
  As a Senior Data Analyst at FERMÀT, you'll be responsible for connecting all of our data systems to drive insights. You will also support our customer success team and internal engineering teams with data piping, analysis, and cleanliness + accuracy.
  Key Responsibilities
 
   Gather, clean, and analyze data from various sources to provide actionable insights to the Finance + Ops and Account Management team
   Work with the product management and internal engineering team to pipe product data into our data warehouse + extract user insights
   Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and visualizations using Looker to track key performance metrics and trends.
   Utilize strong SQL skills to extract and manipulate data from our data warehouse to support ad-hoc analysis and reporting needs.
 
  Qualifications
 
   4+ years in a data analyst type role with experience connecting product data to BigQuery and piping data into various sales + marketing tools
   Experience with the following : GCP, BigQuery, Posthog, Postgres, Fivetran (or another ETL tool), Hightouch
   Strong proficiency in SQL for querying and manipulating data
   Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
   Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.
   Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities effectively.
 
 
  Good to Have
 
   Familiarity with data warehouse concepts and experience working with large datasets.
   Experience with eCommerce or ad tech
   Experience working with data visualization tools, preferably Looker
 
  Benefits

   Equity package
   100% Covered Healthcare Benefits (medical, dental, vision) For You, 80% For Your Partner
   4 Months Paid Parental Leave
   Unlimited PTO Policy
   $500 One-Time WFH Stipend
   $50 / Month Wellness Stipend
 
  Compensation Range: $110K - $140K

Get to know us: NOVO Health Services, with headquarters in Atlanta, GA, offers linen management solutions to the healthcare industry. NOVO keenly focuses on safety and infection control and provides its partner hospitals with a value-driven linen management control system that measures and monitors linen utilization by department to eliminate excess internal costs. NOVO’s wide range of service programs offer a variety of options to provide a seamless, single source distribution system. NOVO’s regional healthcare linen facilities are HLAC accredited and operate with state-of-the-art processing equipment and processes.
NOVO Health Services is the only “one stop shop” service provider in U.S. currently serving all healthcare-related end markets with both Healthcare Laundry Services as well as Sterilized Reusable Surgical Solutions.
Job Summary: 
We are currently looking for a Senior Data Analyst. The perfect candidate is someone who is confident in decision making, can act quickly, and has excellent communication skills. If you are ready to make a commitment to measurable performance and continuous improvements, then we want to hear from you!
As a Senior Data Analyst at NOVO Health Services, you will consult with cross-functional teams to identify data and analytical needs, gather the necessary data, conduct detailed analyses, provide “user-friendly” avenues for sharing actionable data, review insights/findings with leadership to assist in their decision making, and facilitate related process/data improvement efforts.

Oracle Database
SQL Server and Database
SAP Crystal Reports
Ability:
Gather, interpret, analyze, evaluate, and present a variety of management analysis
Prepare regular monthly/quarterly/annual and ad hoc in-house statistical reports
Written communication skills, including ability to draft persuasive budget or requests by defining problem areas, justifying needs, and preparing subsequent project evaluation reports
Identify and evaluate concrete and abstract variables
Persuade, justify, and project consequences of decisions and/or recommendations
Plan coordinate and initiate action necessary to implement recommendations
Define problem areas
Interact with personnel at all organizational levels and function in stressful and/or confrontational situations
Initiate, plan, and complete work assignments with a minimum amount of supervision, applying the technical skills level required
Supervise, coordinate, train, evaluate, and direct the staff and activities of assigned programs (Sr. Management Analyst)
Manage multiple tasks simultaneously
Organize and oversee work, and the work of others, to effectively meet deadlines

NOVO Health Services strives to be the employer of choice in the hospital sterile and hygienically clean linen industry. To do that, we provide a safe, positive work environment where our associates experience tremendous growth and related opportunities for advancement.

Hi, We’re AppFolio
  
  
    We’re innovators, changemakers, and collaborators. We’re more than just a software company – we’re pioneers in cloud and AI who deliver magical experiences that make our customers’ lives easier. We’re revolutionizing how people do business in the real estate industry, and we want your ideas, enthusiasm, and passion to help us keep innovating.
  
   Who Are We Looking For?
   A Sr Payments Product Data Scientist to support the Payments Product Team through various data analyses, utilizing SQL, Python/R to discover product improvement opportunities while conducting experimentation across our Payments product. Additionally, a strong communicator with a keen eye for detail and proven experience working cross-functionally for product leadership to drive critical decisions.
   Your Impact
  
   
    
      Perform exploratory analyses to uncover growth opportunities for our Payments product
    
   
    
     
       Become a subject matter expert on AppFolio’s Payments business, Product Data, and user behavior trends
     
    
     
       Partner closely with Product Dev Teams to answer business-critical questions and drive our product pipeline through KPI and funnel creation
     
    
     
       Discover actionable insights for product optimization through user activation and retention journey and classification analyses to accelerate product growth
     
    
     
       Develop data-driven hypotheses for high ROI investments in our Payments offering
     
    
     
       Create DBT models that combine data from multiple sources where necessary, to enable analyses, modeling and experiments
     
   
  
  
  
   
    
      Be a strategic partner for Payments product experimentation (A/B testing, feature rollouts, price changes)
    
   
    
     
       Advise on best experimental framework and strategy to empower development decisioning
     
    
     
       Execute on experiments in coordination with Prod Dev teams, advising on success metrics, organization of data structures and information, output table structure, iterative adjustments on test-design and execution.
     
    
     
       Present clear, accurate, and actionable deliverables to secure stakeholder approval or incorporation into financial models
     
    
     
       Inform cross-functional teams of experiment results and advocate for integration into financial planning models
     
   
  
  
  
   
    
      Present and operationalize outcomes to stakeholders through various methods including presentations, tracking, and data products
    
   
    
     
       Share back analysis results to technical and non-technical stakeholders, in a clear and accurate way to support data driven drive decision-making
     
    
     
       Create easy to understand assets, including presentations, dashboards and readouts to walkthrough data analyses and explain analysis insights
     
    
     
       Create complex and insightful Data Products to help support actionable business outcomes based on data analysis results made accessible in self-serve tools or dashboards
     
    
     
       Continually update and optimize the product dashboard suite to be best-in-class and enabling Payments leaders to make crucial organizational decisions
       
     
   
  
   Qualifications
  
    Business acumen – understands key challenges facing our business and partners with key stakeholders to find creative ways to apply data science to solve them; connects dots between data & business outcomes
   
    
      Data Science skills – able to identify, measure, model, and impact the important metrics needed to deeply understand and grow the Payments business lines. Additionally, able to build self serve tools, launch exploratory analyses, leveraging statistical models and run A/B tests.
    
   
    
      Attention to detail – appropriately checks all work for errors and does not let important details slip when it comes to data and its accuracy.
    
   
    
      Creative problem solving - able to use creativity and curiosity as tools to pick apart any problem, producing a solution which is relevant and realistic.
    
    Efficiency – able to quickly iterate on data generation and refinement. Looks for ways to improve processes to maximize efficiency and remove redundancy.
  
   Must-Haves
  
    BS or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field; or equivalent professional experience.
   
    
      Highly self-motivated and self-directed
    
   
    
      5+ years of work experience in a Data Science & Analytics team
    
   
    
      Strong business acumen and experience in a business setting
    
   
    
      Strong Tableau, statistical software (e.g. Python, R) and relational database languages (e.g., SQL - Snowflake preferred).
    
   
    
      5+ years Product Analytics and user behavioral data expertise.
    
   
    
      Ability to support, work and communicate with a fast, cross-functional team
    
   
    
      Excellent written and oral communication skills
    
   
    
      Listening and interpersonal skills; ability to communicate ideas in both technical and business terms
    
   
    
      Proven analytical and creative problem-solving abilities
    
    Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment
  
  
   Compensation & Benefits
   The base salary/hourly wage that we reasonably expect to pay for this role is: $123,000-185,000
   The actual base salary/hourly wage for this role will be determined by a variety of factors, including but not limited to: the candidate’s skills, education, experience, etc. Please note that base pay is one important aspect of a compelling Total Rewards package. The base pay range indicated here does not include any additional benefits or bonuses/commissions that you may be eligible for based on your role and/or employment type. 
   
   Regular full-time employees are eligible for benefits - see here.
 
  We accept applications on an ongoing basis.
positionName: Sr. Data Scientist, Payments Product Growth

description:
Who are we:
 
 
   SewerAI is changing the way cities maintain their infrastructure by utilizing massive amounts of video data and AI/ML. We are looking for a Annotation Team Manager to join our team who is dedicated to quality and efficiency, producing data that helps SewerAI deliver real-time insights to cities around the world.
 
 
 
   About The Job
 
 
   We are looking for a data manager to own our entire annotation process, managing both an internal team of technicians as well as coordinating and overseeing outsourced projects. You will work closely with the AI Engineering team to develop project requirements and coordinate data management. Our data needs are varied and often updated as we work to improve our models, so you will need to be able to quickly learn and then train your team on new tasks.
  
 Preferred qualifications
 
   3+ years experience managing a machine learning focused data annotation team
   Experience managing outsourced annotation projects, including contract negotiation, pricing, setting SLAs, and quality assurance
   Strong technical skills with regards to annotation, quality assurance, and worker management tools
   Familiarity with standard image and video annotation types — labels, bounding boxes, polygons, segmentation masks, tracks
   Strong verbal and written skills, ability to communicate effectively with all levels throughout the organization
   Results driven, with strong analytical and problem solving skills
 
  Willingness to learn
 
   Domain knowledge about the wastewater industry and the pipe inspection process (As part of onboarding you will get training in NASSCO sewer inspection standards)
   Become an expert in the SewerAI annotation process, pipeline, and toolset
 
  Responsibilities
 
   Gather project requirements and formulate project timelines
   Manage our internal team of AI data technicians, tracking progress and quality
   Coordinate between technicians and engineers to ensure data is being annotated to spec
   Gather quotes, produce cost estimates, and ultimately manage projects with external labeling services
   Produce documentation and training materials
   Manage hiring for the team
 
  Salary & Perks
 
   Tools you need to get the job done
   Competitive salary and potential equity based remuneration
   Budget for courses, books, conferences – your development is important to us
 
 
   Salary range listed is for fully remote position. Additional compensation is available for candidates who live in the San Francisco Bay Area and are able to work in our Walnut Creek office 1-2 days per week.
   
 
 
  
 
  The compensation range provided is in compliance with state specific laws. Factors that may be used to determine your actual rate of pay include your specific skills, years of experience and other factors.
 
 
 
   Benefits include:
 
 
   Medical, Dental, Vision, Basic Life, 401K and much more
 
 
   Unlimited PTO
 
 
   Why SewerAI:
 
 
 
   SewerAI is applying AI to the massive problem of sewer overflows. Most people aren't aware but our sewer infrastructure is crumbling around us, leaking enough sewage nationwide to cover the entire SF bay area in 7" of raw sewage.
 
 
 
   We are revolutionizing the antiquated industry by automating the labor intensive part of labeling cracks, roots and grease in pipeline inspection videos.
 
 
 
   We are a Series A funded startup with a large and growing client base looking for a talented engineer to help improve our AI system.
 
 
   Come join a startup that is solving a real world problem with AI.
 
 
 
   Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

OpenResearch is conducting the most comprehensive unconditional cash transfer RCT in the United States. We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our team and play an integral role in driving data analysis across a number of research topics (including employment, expenditures, health, housing, time use, etc.)
Responsibilities

 Develop, enhance, and maintain STATA and R analytic datasets
 Utilize statistical analysis to identify trends and extract meaningful insights
 Create informative and visually compelling reports, tables, and graphics related to data analysis and to present data insights
 Develop processes to clean and consolidate datasets
 Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to investigate specific outcomes or hypotheses
 Ensure all data-related activities adhere to relevant data security and protection standards

Who We're Looking For

 Masters’ degree or higher in Statistics, Public Health, Mathematics, Economics, Data Science, or related field with a minimum of 5 years of experience
 Programming and data analysis skills in both R and STATA statistical programming languages
 Strong fluency in R is essential
 Experience with analytical approaches, statistical methodology, and statistical analysis and modeling
 Demonstrated proficiency in data management including data cleaning, data storage and archiving, data analysis, data visualization, and data interpretation
 Experience aggregating and manipulating complex data from multiple sources
 Demonstrated knowledge of best practices, methods, and strategies to ensure use of high-quality data to inform complex issues
 Ability to work both independently, in a self-directed manner, and as a team member
 Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to produce clear and compelling written materials geared towards technical and non-technical audiences
 Strong investigation skills
 Understanding of experimental design and causal inference
 Previous research experience and experience working on RCTs is a plus; interest in domestic economic and social policy issues also a plus
 Proven ability to consistently manage and prioritize multiple tasks, projects, and relationships; willingness to learn and adapt to changes

Additional Information

 You'll have the opportunity to do important work as part of a small, supportive team as well as opportunities for advancement and a commitment to helping staff grow
 We offer a competitive salary and benefits with full medical, dental, and vision coverage. We also offer a 401(k) with employer contribution, unlimited PTO, and 16 weeks of parental leave
 This is a full-time position. We are open to remote candidates in the U.S or those interested in working from our office in San Francisco
 The start date is June 1, with the option to start sooner
 If you are on the fence about applying because you are unsure whether you are qualified, we would strongly encourage you to apply. Above all, we are looking for excellent problem solvers who are motivated to contribute to our mission and excited to join our small but growing team

About OpenResearch 
OpenResearch is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit research lab that seeks to answer pivotal, open-ended research questions. Our flagship project is a 3000 person trial of unconditional cash in the United States.
Read more about the project: openresearchlab.org
We are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, or other non-merit factor.
Apply here:
https://jobs.lever.co/openresearch/eaa51aa5-7d41-48a2-acd8-204fd9703f5d

Company Description
  Experian is the world’s leading global information services company. During life’s big moments – from buying a home or a car, to sending a child to college, to growing a business by connecting with new customers – we empower consumers and our clients to manage their data with confidence. We help individuals to take financial control and access financial services, businesses to make smarter decisions and thrive, lenders to lend more responsibly, and organizations to prevent identity fraud and crime.
  We have 20,000 people operating across 44 countries and every day we’re investing in new technologies, talented people, and innovation to help all our clients maximize every opportunity
  We are very proud that FORTUNE named us one of The 100 Best Companies to Work For. In addition, for the last five years we’ve been named in the 100 “World’s Most Innovative Companies” by Forbes Magazine. Job Description
  Experian NA Innovation Lab is a R&D unit at Experian formed with the desire to work in collaboration with Experian’s business units to enhance relationships with clients and acquire strategic datasets. Experian® is a global leader in providing information, analytical tools and marketing services to organizations and consumers to help manage the risk and reward of commercial and financial decisions. Using our comprehensive understanding of individuals, markets and economies, we help organizations find, develop and manage customer relationships to make their businesses more profitable.
  What You’ll Be Doing
  As a Senior Data Scientist at the Experian Innovation Lab, your role will be to research and develop innovative analytical solutions, prototype new products, and evaluate data assets. You must bring a deep understanding and extensive experience in predictive modeling, machine learning, and deep learning to this position. Key job functions include:
 
   Craft advanced machine learning analytical solutions to extract insights from diverse structured and unstructured data sources.
   Unearth data value by selecting and applying the right machine learning, deep learning and processing techniques.
   Streamline data manipulation and retrieval through the design of efficient data structures and storage solutions.
   Innovate with tools designed for optimal data processing and information retrieval.
   Dissect and document vast datasets, analyzing and processing them to highlight significant patterns and insights.
   Solve complex business challenges by applying, developing, and inventing impactful algorithms.
   Ensure model excellence by validating performance scores and analyzing ROI and benefits.
   Articulate model processes and outcomes, documenting and presenting findings and performance metrics clearly.
 
  As part of our commitment to innovation, you will also have the unique opportunity to engage with projects involving Generative AI and Large Language Models (LLM). This separate aspect of the role allows you to explore the forefront of AI technology, applying your Data Science skills to develop solutions that leverage the latest in AI research and applications. Whether you are already skilled in AI or eager to learn, this opportunity will enable you to expand your technical repertoire and contribute to cutting-edge projects that explore new horizons in the tech landscape. Qualifications
  Basic Qualifications:
 
   Advanced degree in Machine Learning, Data Science, AI, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field.
   3-7 years of working experience in AI, data science, and/or predictive modeling
   Proficiency in multiple programming languages, including but not limited to Python, R, Java, C++, and C.
   Experience in deep learning (CNN, RNN, LSTM, attention models, etc.), machine learning methodologies (SVM, GLM, boosting, random forest, etc.), graph models, and/or, reinforcement learning.
   Experience with open-source tools for deep learning and machine learning technology such as pytorch, Keras, tensorflow, scikit-learn, pandas, etc.
   Experience with large data analysis using Spark (pySpark preferred)
 
  Preferred Qualifications:
 
   Experience with LLMs and the relevant tools in the Generative AI domain.
   Experience in developing, modifying and experimenting advanced language models
   Experience in developing/applying/evaluating Generative AI based tools and technology
   Experience with Hadoop and NoSQL related technologies such as Map Reduce, Hive, HBase, mongoDB, Cassandra, etc.
   Experience with modifying and applying advanced algorithms to address practical problems
 
   Additional Information
  Why choose us?
  Our colleagues’ health and wellbeing are a top priority for us, that’s why our reward, benefits and wellbeing programs are designed so you can come to work feeling your very best self. Our benefits focus on health, money, and lifestyle so you can tailor your benefits to your own personal needs. Whether it’s your physical and mental wellness, getting to work or preparing for the next big milestone in your life, we have a range of flexible options to have you covered!
 
   To learn more about our culture and what it’s really like to work here, check out our interactive guide here: https://view.pagetiger.com/experianguideforcandidates/1
   Could this be the role for you? Apply now to start your journey with Experian.
   To learn more about our culture and what it’s really like to work here, check out our LinkedIn and social media channels using the hashtags #UniquelyExperian
   Youtube video link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=trvcHqr81TY
   Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together
   Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here
 
  Perks
 
   Flexible work schedule and relaxed dress code
   Fully remote or in-office hybrid model, depending on location
   Competitively priced medical and dental plans
   Well-rounded employer-matched 401(k) plan
   Free/discounted benefits and services, such as tax-free commuter passes and free credit monitoring
   A well-balanced work-life balance that includes generous sick and vacation time
   Experian is an Equal Opportunity Employer
   Anyone needing accommodation to complete the interview process should notify the talent acquisition partner

About us: 
   RevenueCat makes building, analyzing, and growing mobile subscriptions easy. We launched as part of Y Combinator's summer 2018 batch and today are handling more than $2B of in-app purchases annually across thousands of apps. 
   We are a mission driven, remote-first company that is building the standard for mobile subscription infrastructure. Top apps like VSCO, Notion, and ClassDojo count on RevenueCat to power their subscriptions at scale. 
   Our 70 team members (and growing!) are located all over the world, from San Francisco to Madrid to Taipei. We're a close-knit, product-driven team, and we strive to live our core values: Customer Obsession, Always Be Shipping, Own It, and Balance.
 
  We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to help us enable developers to make better decisions by using the unique data we have collected across the subscription ecosystem. We will do so by shipping data-enabled features, for example Lifetime Value (LTV) prediction, statistical significance for our Experimentation tool, or benchmarking. This role will work closely with the product team owning our customer facing data features. 
  Our data tech stack currently includes our Python backend, PostgreSQL production database, Snowflake data warehouse, and dbt for data transformation. We are running on AWS. 
  About you: 
 
  You are proficient in SQL and are comfortable with data modeling 
  You have experience building predictive models 
  You have built production-ready data pipelines and Python models 
  You are driven by creating value for customers, not just scientific accuracy and you see perfect as the enemy of done 
  You are comfortable with ambiguity, lack of structure, and an environment where you can (and have to) build a lot from scratch 
  You understand how to best convey data and insights to broad audiences to help them make better decisions 
  You are interested in the consumer mobile subscription ecosystem and are excited to explore the data we have 
 
 In the first month, you'll: 
 
  Understand our data models 
  Get to know the team 
  Ramp up on the ongoing data feature work 
 
 Within the first 3 months, you'll: 
 
  Meaningfully contribute to shipping a data feature to thousands of developers 
  Work with our product, analytics and engineering teams to improve our data pipelines for data science features 
  Launch your own explorations into our data to fulfill your own curiosity 
 
 Within the first 6 months, you'll: 
 
  Contribute to the roadmap of the data feature team 
  Ship, own, and continuously improve predictive models powering customer facing features 
  Contribute to architecting and further developing our data tech stack 
 
 Within the first 12 months, you'll:

 What we offer:

     Job Description: 
     
      
       
         
       
       
         The Robotic Process Automation (RPA) AI Engineer involves designing, analyzing, developing, testing, implementing, supporting, and enhancing sophisticated RPA solutions and AI/ML technologies to meet the evolving needs of the enterprise. The individual in this role is an experienced professional working under general supervision who will work on large and moderately complex projects or assignments. You will be responsible for minor moderate changes in systems and processes with opportunity to work on larger and more complex problems. Most troubleshooting will span range of issues, which are typically solved through prior experience and analysis of the details. You will also collaborate with business analysts, client areas, and technical staff to identify and specify requirements for technical solutions within the Purdue University system.
         
         
        Additionally, the role encompasses the responsibility to install, configure, develop, test, maintain, and support operating systems, application software, and system management tools to facilitate RPA solutions. Continuous monitoring of installed systems and infrastructure is required to ensure stability, integrity, security, and efficient operation of in-house automations. You will play a crucial role in determining RPA design requirements and overseeing the successful implementation and monitoring of system improvements to increase efficiency.
         
         
        In this role, you will be responsible for implementing changes in systems and processes to solve problems or enhance the effectiveness of RPA solutions. Effective communication with internal and external stakeholders is essential to influence others regarding facts, policies, and practices related to RPA and AI. This role contributes to the advancement of RPA and AI technologies at Purdue University and supports the overall growth of the institution's technological capabilities. You will also provide support for automations after hours and on weekends as needed.
         
         
        This position has a target salary between $60,100 - $70,975 commensurate with education and experience.

   Job Description:
 
 
   Own the opportunity as a Sr Data Science Developer and help ensure the mission is never interrupted. At GDIT, we deliver clarity with our cloud solutions and provide meaningful work. Your work will be an important part of transforming our clients for the modern age and help them face any obstacle.
   
   As a Sr Data Science Developer you will help ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. Our work depends on Sr Data Science Developer joining our team to to drive innovation and excellence in cloud computing solutions, enhancing our capabilities in serving our client's needs to provide quality data about the nation's people and economy.
   
   HOW YOU WILL MAKE AN IMPACT
 
 
  
   
     Perform scientific work associated with the analytical, statistical, and programming skills to collect, analyze, and interpret large data sets; develop data-driven solutions to difficult business challenges
   
  
   
     Design and implement advanced statistical models and machine learning algorithms to analyze large datasets.
   
  
   
     Lead the development and deployment of predictive models and analytics solutions to solve business challenges.
   
  
   
     Conduct data exploration and visualization to communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
   
  
   
     Maintain and enhance the data analytics platforms to support ongoing analytics and data science projects.
   
  
   
     Provide guidance on best practices in data science and analytics within the team and organization.
   
  
   
     Evaluate emerging technologies and methodologies to drive innovation in data analytics and model development.
   
  
   
     Lead discussions with Federal clients and other data scientists
   
  
   
     Work with a team of dedicated professionals in a fast-paced team-oriented environment. This is a collegial atmosphere where everyone pitches in to ensure mission success.
   
 
 
   WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO SUCCEED
 
 
  Education: Bachelor degree in Science or Engineering or relevant technology based discipline (Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field)
  Required Experience: 12 years of related experience
  Required Technical Skills and Abilities:
 
 
   Experience writing, maintaining, and customizing Python scripts that extract text from various formats, pull data from web-based APIs and relational databases
   Experience with AWS/Cloud-native development
   Proven expertise in statistical modeling, machine learning algorithms, and data mining techniques.
   Strong programming skills in Python, R, SQL languages and tools for data analysis.
   Experience working with large datasets and complex data structures, building new algorithms, etc.
   Knowledge of data visualization tools and techniques to effectively present data insights.
   Experience analyzing complex datasets to provide insightful solutions, enhancing data-driven decision-making processes
   Ability to collaborate effectively with teams across different disciplines and levels of technical understanding
 
 
  
    Location: Remote
   US Citizenship Required
  
   GDIT IS YOUR PLACE:
   
  
   Full-flex work week to own your priorities at work and at home
   401K with company match
   Comprehensive health and wellness packages
   Internal mobility team dedicated to helping you own your career
   Professional growth opportunities including paid education and certifications
   Cutting-edge technology you can learn from
   Rest and recharge with paid vacation and holidays
  
 
  The likely salary range for this position is $128,000 - $192,000. This is not, however, a guarantee of compensation or salary. Rather, salary will be set based on experience, geographic location and possibly contractual requirements and could fall outside of this range.

  40

  Less than 10%

  Remote

  Any Location / Remote
 
 
   Additional Work Locations:
 
 
 
   Total Rewards at GDIT:
  Our benefits package for all US-based employees includes a variety of medical plan options, some with Health Savings Accounts, dental plan options, a vision plan, and a 401(k) plan offering the ability to contribute both pre and post-tax dollars up to the IRS annual limits and receive a company match. To encourage work/life balance, GDIT offers employees full flex work weeks where possible and a variety of paid time off plans, including vacation, sick and personal time, holidays, paid parental, military, bereavement and jury duty leave. GDIT typically provides new employees with 15 days of paid leave per calendar year to be used for vacations, personal business, and illness and an additional 10 paid holidays per year. Paid leave and paid holidays are prorated based on the employee’s date of hire. The GDIT Paid Family Leave program provides a total of up to 160 hours of paid leave in a rolling 12 month period for eligible employees. To ensure our employees are able to protect their income, other offerings such as short and long-term disability benefits, life, accidental death and dismemberment, personal accident, critical illness and business travel and accident insurance are provided or available. We regularly review our Total Rewards package to ensure our offerings are competitive and reflect what our employees have told us they value most.
  We are GDIT. A global technology and professional services company that delivers consulting, technology and mission services to every major agency across the U.S. government, defense and intelligence community. Our 30,000 experts extract the power of technology to create immediate value and deliver solutions at the edge of innovation. We operate across 30 countries worldwide, offering leading capabilities in digital modernization, AI/ML, Cloud, Cyber and application development. Together with our clients, we strive to create a safer, smarter world by harnessing the power of deep expertise and advanced technology.
  We connect people with the most impactful client missions, creating an unparalleled work experience that allows them to see their impact every day. We create opportunities for our people to lead and learn simultaneously. From securing our nation’s most sensitive systems, to enabling digital transformation and cloud adoption, our people are the ones who make change real.

And as one of the fastest-growing companies in a $600B+ industry — we must be doing something right.

We're seeking people who continually put our purpose first: advocating for pros and customers, embracing change, and choosing teamwork every day.

  About the Machine Learning Infrastructure Team 
  At Thumbtack, our challenges span a wide variety of areas, ranging from building search, ranking & recommendations systems to optimizing pricing and spam detection models. The ML Infrastructure team is responsible for centralizing, standardizing and evolving machine learning infrastructure capabilities for teams across engineering that experiment with or deploy machine learning models for different problems. To read more about some of the engineering challenges at Thumbtack, visit our engineering blog. 
  About the Role 
  As a Senior Software Engineer focused on ML Infrastructure, you'll focus on bringing the Thumbtack's ML Infrastructure vision to life. You'll collaborate with engineers, applied scientists and product managers across engineering to refine and execute on our shared vision for generative AI, feature platforms, model deployment, and model monitoring. This could include introducing the latest feature engineering & model building frameworks, creating a standardized process for model deployment and monitoring, working with the data platform team on evolving feature storage, or working with applied scientists on productization of complex models. 
  Responsibilities 
 
  Collaborate with engineers, applied scientists and product managers to identify shared ML infrastructure needs across areas like feature engineering, model experimentation, model inference & CI/CD, generative AI, and model monitoring. 
  Build, maintain, and communicate our roadmap. 
  Centralize and standardize ML infrastructure & associated best practices for product teams across engineering. 
  When appropriate, experiment with and introduce next-generation ML infrastructure capabilities and frameworks so product teams can continue to harness the power of open source / vendor-driven advances in machine learning. 
  Drive projects to completion with a tenacious focus on the business impact of those projects. 
  Solve tough technical problems and stay up-to-date with the latest advances in this constantly evolving problem space. 
 
 What you'll need 
 If you don't think you meet all of the criteria below but still are interested in the job, please apply. Nobody checks every box, and we're looking for someone excited to join the team. 
 
  5+ years of industry experience in engineering. 
  2+ years of industry experience working on machine learning modeling or infrastructure. 
  You're fluent in at least one major programming language and would be able to switch between multiple languages. In our stack, we use Go and Python most heavily. 
  You have experience building software on top of relational databases such as Postgres or MySQL. 
  You can break down complex problems rigorously and understand the tradeoffs necessary to deliver great, impactful products. 
  You're curious, you're data-driven, you love to ask questions, and you think critically about problems. 
  You love delivering value to your users and your teammates through your work. 
 
 Bonus points if you have 
 
  You have experience building and evolving machine learning infrastructure. 
  You have worked with frameworks like PyTorch, Tensorflow, Scikit-learn, and Airflow 
  You have experience with generative AI infrastructure and vendors 
  You have experience building and maintaining reliable, performant distributed systems. 
  You're familiar working with major cloud providers and/or the big data ecosystem (Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, Spark, etc). 
  You've demonstrated your ability to thrive in a fast-paced startup environment.

As a Principal Statistical Programmer, you will be joining the world’s largest & most comprehensive clinical research organization, powered by healthcare intelligence.
What you will be doing:
The Principal Statistical Programmer will lead and support all programming activities per the project strategies. The incumbent should be able to work independently implementing and executing the programming and project standard to support ongoing clinical studies and requests for study report, regulatory submission, and ad hoc/post hoc analysis. The incumbent will work closely with internal partnering functions, stakeholders, and external functional service providers to ensure all the programming deliverables are delivered in timely manner with high quality. Provides documentation and consistent maintenance of code, logs, and output in a regulated environment. The incumbent will participate in and contribute to department goals and SME topics.

 Lead programming support within multiple studies/projects in various study activities to ensures timely and high-quality programming deliverables in assigned projects and areas. Develop and maintain programming documentations and specifications following programming standards and processes.
 Demonstrate company values by demonstrating excellence, competence, collaboration, innovation, respect, ownership, and accountability.
 Understand the scope of work, plan and complete the deliveries and timelines with the study team, programming lead and management.
 Support global regulatory authority submissions including preparing programming deliverable for submission and working closely with partnering functions to address health authority requests.
 Participate and contribute towards department goals and SME topics.
 Mentor and Coach new hires and junior programmers.

You are:
MS. (BS) in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Life Science or related discipline with 5+ (6+) years of programming experience preferably in processing clinical trial data in the biotechnology, pharmaceutical or health related industry. SAS Certification desirable.
Required Skills

 Proficiency in SAS programming skills in a clinical data environment with excellent analytical skills. Knowledge of other programming languages such as R, Python etc. is a plus.
 Good knowledge of pharmaceutical clinical development (i.e., understanding of statistical concepts, techniques, and clinical trial principles). Knowledge of regulatory submissions and requirements is a plus.
 Ability to work on global interdisciplinary teams. Good organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills. Positive attitude, team player and growth mindset
 Problem solving and innovative skills that demonstrate initiative and motivation.

Required Special Equipment And/ Or Programs
SAS, (Base, Stat, Macro, graph); SAS certificates a plus

 Education and Requirements:

We have been recognized as one of Ohio's fastest growing companies and won 2020 Best Places to Work, LinkedIn's Top 50 Tech Startups in 2020,2022, and 2023, Purpose Jobs 2023 Best Workplace Culture and Best Work-life balance, and Purpose Jobs best place to work in 2024. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Visa Sponsorship is not included in our hiring package. Applicants will need to be authorized to work in the U.S.

description:
Unleash the Power of Data and Drive Exponential Growth 

 Are you a passionate innovator with a deep understanding of machine learning and a knack for applying it to drive business growth? If so, then we're searching for a visionary Lead Machine Learning Engineer to propel our Growth Team to new heights. 

 The Mission:
 You'll lead a team of talented machine learning engineers, spearheading the development of cutting-edge algorithms and models that will transform our understanding of user behavior, market trends, and growth opportunities. Your insights will fuel data-driven strategies for customer acquisition, user engagement, and revenue expansion. 

 Key Responsibilities:
 
 
 Strategic Visionary: Develop and execute a comprehensive machine learning roadmap that aligns with the Growth Team's objectives. 
 Technical Maestro: Design, build, and deploy scalable machine learning solutions that optimize performance for key growth metrics. 
 Insight Hunter: Conduct in-depth data analysis, uncovering patterns and trends that will unlock new growth avenues. 
 Innovation Catalyst: Proactively research and implement new machine learning techniques to push the boundaries of possibility. 
 Collaborative Leader: Mentor, guide, and inspire a team of machine learning engineers, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous learning. 
 Cross-Functional Collaborator: Partner with product managers, marketing specialists, and other stakeholders to integrate machine learning insights across the business. 
 We're Looking For:
 
 
 Proven track record of success in developing and deploying machine learning models within a growth-focused environment. 
 Master's degree or Ph.D. in computer science, statistics, or a related field. 
 Deep expertise with machine learning libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn. 
 Business Acumen: Ability to translate complex data insights into actionable growth strategies. 
 Leadership Mindset: Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills to inspire and lead high-performing teams. 
 Ready to Make an Impact? 

 Join our clients dynamic Growth Team and shape the future of our business. We offer a competitive compensation package, a collaborative environment, and the opportunity to work on truly transformative projects. Apply now and let's embark on this growth journey together! 

 We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workforce. 

 At this time, we are unable to offer immigration assistance, including sponsorships or visa transfers. As such, we kindly request that applicants possess a US Green Card or citizenship. We appreciate your understanding and thank you for your interest in joining our team. 

 Note from the Recruiter - Larry Hernandez 

 We understand that job searching can be a challenging and frustrating process. Therefore, we kindly request you to apply for this job only if you currently hold the position of a Senior or Lead Machine Learning Engineer with prior experience in Growth Team. By doing so, you will help us connect with the right person for this role. 

 Please use this application link to share your resume if you are not a great match for this particular rolehttps://jobs.crelate.com/portal/devopsdna/job/apply/general 

 Thank you for your cooperation. We receive over 300 applications every week for each job posting, which makes it challenging to identify the best candidate for the role. This process tends to slow down the recruitment process, and we apologize for any delay in getting back to you.
